summary: hey guys im like totally cool with you know making live action movies of traditionally cartoonish animated things like pokemon...
body:
hey guys im like totally cool with you know making live action movies of traditionally cartoonish animated things like pokemon and sonic and all but could we just uh. all get on board with roger rabbit rules?

like okay if you have an AMAZING way to translate this cartoonish character to a more realistic style, go for it. detective pikachu is kinda hit and miss here, some of the designs are great and other ones i wish they would have commited more to the either realistic or the cartoony side, plus i wish there was less emphasis on the realistic=add textures to cartoon without changing porportions idea, but you know what they did fine mostly. and while the sonic silhouette is for right now full of mostly horrifying possibility maybe it will turn out fine!! butimnotholdingmybreath

but i dont think im the only one who would be perfectly fine with completely unrealistic, obviously animated characters. does it break the “immersion”? yeah, a little, especially if its done badly. but when its done well, a la roger rabbit, it doesnt really matter if youre not completely immersed because it just looks good. if you have actually good realistic designs, use them!! but if its a choice between this weird uncanny valley thing where you just slap a million hair follicles and some detailed ass eyes on the usual model, vs a really cute but obviously animated game style character, i want the latter. please give me the latter. i promise you, i wont walk out of the theatre because i cant see every pore on sonics muzzle.

summary:
I got something i need to say and its rather controversial. 
Recently we have seen trailers and a poster of the sonic movie, the...
body:
I got something i need to say and its rather controversial.

Recently we have seen trailers and a poster of the sonic movie, the lion king remake, detective pikachu and aladdin remake. And also recently ive been seeing people say that they are devaluing 2d animation. I respectfully disagree (kinda).

When it comes to Detective pikachu and the sonic movie (despite the latter looking like utter dog shit), i feel like i need to defend them by saying that they are not remakes but adaptations, and their original source does not come from a medium like the other 2. So i fail to see how those 2 “devalue” 2d animation.

When it comes to the lion king, i feel like i need to say this: i did not like the original. For what ever reason, i couldn’t find myself enjoying it as much as everyone else did. While i do see some reasons why people have their gripes about the remake, im hoping that it puts the original in a new light, hopefully in a way thay i enjoy.

Aladdin……..alright. yall can have that one. It looks very bland and colorless. It does help that im a huge fan of the original.

All in all, i just hope igot my thoughts across clearly.

summary: The difference between Detective Pikachu and live-action Sonic is that they still stayed close to the original Pokemon designs...
body: The difference between Detective Pikachu and live-action Sonic is that they still stayed close to the original Pokemon designs in Detective Pikachu. I know that people are probably going to be comparing the two but I feel that’s kind of unfair. And I know that live-action Mr. Mime has been freaking everyone out but imagine how much worse it would be if they had given him actual human proportions? Do you want that, America? I sure don’t.
